description: An adaptation of conglūtināt-, the perfect passive participial stem of the Latin conglūtinō. Compare the French conglutiner.

entries.meaning: Glued together; united, as by some adhesive substance.

verbs.description: conglutinate (third-person singular simple present conglutinates, present participle conglutinating, simple past and past participle conglutinated) (transitive, intransitive)

examples: Bones  […]  have had their broken parts conglutinated within three or four days.
